facts: Russia is the largest country in the world by land area, stretching across both Europe and Asia.
Monaco is one of the smallest countries on Earth and is smaller than New York City's Central Park.
South Africa is unique because it has three capital cities: Pretoria, Cape Town, and Bloemfontein.
Japan is made up of thousands of islands, but most of its land and people are on four main islands.
Egypt is often called a transcontinental country because it is in Africa, but the Sinai Peninsula is in Asia.
Canada has the longest coastline of any country, with shores along the Atlantic, Pacific, and Arctic oceans.
Lesotho is a country completely surrounded by another country, because it lies entirely inside South Africa.
